page.title: 14A look at our block.
page.content: The nature of Sheffields land is that it has a lot of hills, therefore there is a lot of hill farming, this is mainly with sheep and cows.All of the factorys are on the east side of the city. This is because the west side of Sheffield is very hilly and not suitable for factories, so the west side is only houses, the houseing stops very abruptly as there is no building allowed in the green belt area so you can get from the city centre to the country side in about 20 minutes. The area that we live in is all sandstone, therefore our school is made of sandstone so is the church next door to us and the other old buildings in this area.Another characteristic of the area in the hill farming industry is drystone walls which are made of gritstone .
